item.title: Fully-jabbed from EU and US could avoid quarantine
item.description: Senior cabinet ministers are due to discuss the move for arrivals to England in a meeting on Wednesday.

item.title: Barbie maker Mattel warns of higher prices as costs rise
item.description: Toy giant Mattel made the comments as it announced better than expected quarterly sales.

item.title: Electric car charging prices 'must be fair' say MPs
item.description: Consumers should not have to pay excessive prices to use public car charging, MPs say.

item.title: Tech giants' profits soar as pandemic boom continues
item.description: Apple, Google parent company Alphabet and Microsoft report soaring quarterly profits.

item.title: Tesco offers £1,000 joining bonus for HGV lorry drivers
item.description: The supermarket chain is deploying the recruitment tactic amid a shortage in lorry drivers.

item.title: IMF upgrades UK economic forecast
item.description: Wealth gap between countries could widen due to differing access to Covid vaccines, the IMF says.

item.title: Morrisons' shareholder will not back takeover bid
item.description: Silchester International says it is not inclined to support a £6.3bn deal for the supermarket chain.

item.title: Covid: Insurance threat for pinged holidaymakers
item.description: Some travel insurance policies will not cover cancellation costs for travellers told to self-isolate.

item.title: Stain remover demand rises as distancing shrinks
item.description: Vanish-maker Reckitt says the end of social distancing has led to a focus on appearance.

item.title: Bid for better bailiffs as pandemic debts rise
item.description: A plan is agreed to reduce aggressive debt collection, although charities still want statutory regulation.

item.title: Activision staff condemn firm's response to harassment claims
item.description: About 1,000 Activision Blizzard staff sign a letter describing managers' response as insulting.

item.title: House prices at new high as buyers seek more space
item.description: Strong demand for houses will last into 2022 as buyers react to the pandemic, says property website Zoopla.

item.title: Tesla profit surge driven by record car deliveries
item.description: The electric carmaker's revenues nearly doubled in the three months to 30 June compared with last year.

item.title: China stocks see biggest slump in US since 2008 financial crisis
item.description: The value of New York-listed Chinese companies has plummeted after a series of crackdowns by Beijing.

item.title: UK defence firm bid monitored by government
item.description: The government says it will monitor the proposed sale of Ultra Electronics to US equity-owned Cobham.

item.title: Bezos' $2bn offer to get back in race to the Moon
item.description: The billionaire offers to cover $2bn in Nasa costs to be reconsidered for a Moon lander contract.

item.title: Covid: More pinged workers eligible for daily tests instead of isolation
item.description: Waste workers, prison staff and defence workers will be able to avoid isolation, the government says.

item.title: Jaguar Land Rover owner Tata Motors feels chip shortage strain
item.description: Tata Motors sees losses narrow, but warns that a lack of semiconductors could halve car production.

item.title: Tesco Bank to close all its current accounts
item.description: The bank says most of the accounts have limited activity and are not being used.

item.title: Air travel yet to meaningfully restart, says UK industry
item.description: Bookings have not recovered due to the "frustrating" traffic light system, a trade group says.

item.title: Ministers consider blocking China's role in UK nuclear power
item.description: The move, amid rising tensions with Beijing, could impact the development of a plant in Suffolk.

item.title: Can better tech make video meetings less excruciating?
item.description: Technology firms are scrambling to add new features but will video calls improve.

item.title: Why remote working leaves us vulnerable to cyber-attacks
item.description: Experts warn working from home has led to complacency over security protocols

item.title: How global conferences are using tech to stay in business
item.description: Moving events online kept the industry going during the pandemic and now they're here to stay.

item.title: Heatwave: The worst jobs to have when temperatures soar
item.description: Not all jobs are equal when it comes to working in extreme heat, but which are the worst?

item.title: Is there a solution to the hospitality staff crisis?
item.description: Aside from Covid and Brexit, are there other reasons for the shortage of hospitality workers?

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'Four-day weeks are good for business'
item.description: CEO Joe Munns says giving his workers a three-day weekend makes them happier and more productive.

item.title: The little tech firm gunning for an airspeed record
item.description: Electroflight has built the E-NXT which it hopes will break the electric airspeed record.

item.title: Using plastic waste to help solve sand shortages
item.description: With construction sand in short supply crushed plastic is being used as an alternative.
